bioghist.p: Samuel Meites was Professor of Pediatrics at the Ohio State University College of Medicine and head of Clinical Chemistry at Children's Hospital of Columbus, Ohio. He was the chair of the History Division of the American Association for Clinical Chemistry (AACC). In 1989, his biography of Otto Folin was published by the AACC. Otto Folin (1867-1934) was a biochemist and professor. He was Hamilton Kuhn Professor of Biological Chemistry at Harvard. More than any individual, he provided the modern practical approach to the microanalysis of blood and other body fluids by introducing new or improved quantitative methods and using them to make systematic studies of metabolism, health, and disease.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of typed manuscript and published copies of Meites's biography of Folin and materials relating to the AACC. The AACC records include: several editions of Clinical Chemistry News (the AACC newsletter); profiles of AACC members written by Louise Simonson and correspondence with Simonson; letters responding to a request for testimonials and biographical sketches of AACC members; and AACC press releases.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
